sections.title: Survive crisis without making things worse
sections.description: Distress tolerance helps you get through crisis moments without making things worse. We use these skills when problems can't be solved immediately and you need to survive intense emotional pain. These techniques help you tolerate distress, self-soothe, and avoid impulsive actions that could harm you or your relationships.

skills.title: TIPP
skills.description: Change your body chemistry quickly in crisis using TIPP: change your Temperature, do Intense exercise, use Paced breathing, and try Paired muscle relaxation

skills.title: STOP
skills.description: Pause before acting on impulses to prevent making situations worse using STOP: Stop what you're doing, Take a breath, Observe your thoughts and feelings, and Proceed mindfully

skills.title: Self-Soothing
skills.description: Comfort yourself through your five senses during difficult times

skills.title: IMPROVE
skills.description: Distract and cope using IMPROVE: Imagery, find Meaning, Prayer/meditation, Relaxation, focus on One thing, take a mental Vacation, and use Encouragement

skills.title: Radical Acceptance
skills.description: Completely accept reality as it is, without fighting against what you cannot change

skills.title: Different Action
skills.description: Act opposite to your urges when emotions don't fit the facts

skills.title: Half-Smiling
skills.description: Use facial expressions to influence your emotional state and promote acceptance
